newsitem.title: JAPAN: Toshiba says two units sued in US over chip patent.
newsitem.headline: Toshiba says two units sued in US over chip patent.

text.p: Toshiba Corp said on Wednesday that two of its U.S. subsidiaries had been sued in the United States by a U.S. venture firm for alleged infringement of a patent on semiconductor technology.
A Toshiba spokesman said that Li Second Family Co filed suit against Toshiba America Inc and Toshiba America Electronic Components Inc in March.
The spokesman said that the company plans to contest Li Second Family's claims in court. He declined to comment further on the details of the legal dispute.

The Japanese business daily Nihon Keizai Shimbun reported in its evening edition on Wednesday that Li Second Family charged Toshiba and its subsidiaries with infringing on its patents on insulation technology for integrated circuits.
The paper said the U.S. firm was suing the Toshiba units for $10 million to $100 million.
